articles.title: Health Canada approves first drug specifically made to treat moderate to severe postpartum depression
articles.description: ZURZUVAE, also known as zuranoline, is a 14-day treatment but clinical trials have reported to show improvements as early as day three

articles.title: What are asteroids really made of? New analysis brings space mining closer to reality
articles.description: Scientists are digging into the hidden makeup of carbon-rich asteroids to see whether they could one day fuel space exploration—or even be mined for valuable resources. articles.title: North Korea displays apparent progress in construction of nuclear-powered submarine
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korea on Thursday displayed apparent progress in the construction of a nuclear-powered submarine, with state media photos showing a largely completed hull, as leader Kim Jong Un condemned rival South Korea’s push to acquire the technology. articles.title: New technology eliminates “forever chemicals” with record-breaking speed and efficiency
articles.description: A new eco-friendly technology can capture and destroy PFAS, the dangerous “forever chemicals” found worldwide in water. The material works hundreds to thousands of times faster and more efficiently than current filters, even in river water, tap water, and wastewater. After trapping the chemicals, th

articles.title: B.C. non-profit warns of gift card fraud during the holidays
articles.description: A warning for anyone getting or giving a gift card this holiday season: scammers may have already stolen the balance.

articles.title: Lethbridge charities reach Christmas Hope fundraising goal
articles.description: The Christmas Hope campaign is a collaborative effort between several charities in Lethbridge and many member organizations say they reached their fundraising goals this year.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Oversees Test of New Anti-Air Missile, KCNA Says
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw the testing of a new type of high-altitude, long-range missile and inspected work being done to build a nuclear-powered submarine, state media reported, ratcheting up tensions after a US nuclear submarine arrived at the South Korean port of Busan.

articles.title: Edmonton father dies in hospital E.R. waiting to see a doctor
articles.description: On Monday, Dec. 22, Prashant Sreekumar, 44, had severe chest pains while at work. A client drove him to the Grey Nuns Hospital where he died waiting to see a doctor.

articles.title: Downtown Eastside non-profit fills a need, distributing food hampers just in time for Christmas
articles.description: A local non-profit stepped up this week, giving out food hampers in the Downtown Eastside, Strathcona, and Chinatown, just in time for Christmas.

articles.title: Canadian Food Inspection Agency recalls vegan bacon product over undeclared wheat
articles.description: OTTAWA — The Canadian Food Inspection Agency has issued a recall for a vegan bacon product sold in Ontario because it contains wheat, which doesn’t appear on the list of ingredients.
